department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Bulbuous vase with narrow neck; garlic bulb motif at mouth; scattered green corrosion overall; no storage box.
text: The so-called "garlic head" vase shape became popular during Han and remained so through the Ch'ing dynasty. This bronze example is the type of vessel that influenced the painted earthenware example shown here.
title: Garlic Head Vase
